note: I was born in Adelaide, Australia and grew up in the country. I moved to the big city at twelve years old where I quickly found my place to be was at the library. I loved reading and soon discovered the power of words. I enjoy a lot of things in life, love animals, being entertained and entertaining others. I work in the education sector and hope I have made a positive impact on the people who have come across my path.

Old, grumpy git. I don't eat Tofu, but am otherwise a fully paid up member of the 'Wokerati' so reviled by our Home Secretary.

I've been a student of Classical Guitar since retiring, and can now read music reasonably. I've played Acoustic Guitar, intermittently, for most of my adult life. I've also taken up the Mandolin in recent years. I'm studying Trad Irish and Bluegrass styles. And. Loving. It!
Just learning about hashtags... #fbpe #wokerati #ClassicalGuitar #Mandolin #MMT

note:
Project Gutenberg, founded in 1971, is the oldest producer and distributor of free ebooks.

According to Michael Hart (March 8, 1947 – September 6, 2011), founder of Project Gutenberg, the mission of Project Gutenberg is simple: to encourage the creation and distribution of eBooks.
This mission is, as much as possible, to encourage all those who are interested in making eBooks and helping to give them away.
